snippet: Before President Obama’s address on ISIS, former Vice President Dick Cheney urged House Republicans to embrace a strong military and try to stop the establishment of a terrorist state in the Middle East.
abstract: Former Vice Pres Dick Cheney arrives at Capitol Hill to urge House Republicans to embrace a strong military and to reject rising isolationism in his party; does not discuss specifics of confronting Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; speech comes on eve of Pres Obama's address to the nation about plans for escalation of military action in Iraq.
lead_paragraph: Before President Obama’s address on ISIS, former Vice President Dick Cheney urged House Republicans to embrace a strong military and try to stop the establishment of a terrorist state in the Middle East.

headline.main: Cheney Urges House G.O.P. to Abandon Isolationism
headline.print_headline: Cheney Urges House G.O.P. to Abandon Isolationism
